text.0: what mātariśvan piercing formed by friction herald of all the gods in varied figure.
text.1: is he whom they have set mid human houses gayhued as light and shining forth for beauty.
text.2: they shall not harm the man who brings thee praises such as i am agni my help approves me.
text.3: all acts of mine shall they accept with pleasure laudation from the singer who presents it.
text.4: him in his constant seat men skilled in worship have taken and with praises have established.
text.5: as harnessed to a chariot fleetfoot horses at his command let bearers lead him forward.
text.6: wondrous full many a thing he chews and crunches he shines amid the wood with spreading brightness.
text.7: upon his glowing flames the wind blows daily driving them like the keen shaft of an archer.
text.8: him whom while yet in embryo the hostile both skilled and fain to harm may never injure.
text.9: men blind and sightless through his splendour hurt not his neverfailing lovers have preserved him.
